result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Derek L Arrigo was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Derek L Arrigo was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.  
Provide DNA Sample, if not already done so.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Report today.  Must start immediately.

records.addlTxt: Letter Request from Defendant with Denied Response from Judge Counsell: cc to parties 03-16-17

Defendant Derek L Arrigo in court with attorney James Michael Klein. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 OWI 4th w/in 5 yrs: No Contest
Count 3 OAR: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 2 is dismissed.

ADA Counsel makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Klein concurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:**PROBATION**
Count 1:
W/H Sentence
24 month Probation
Conditions:
180 days jail,  Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Report today.  Must start immediately.
$600 fine + costs + surcharges = $1,819.00
$26.45 Pay for blood draw costs.
36 months Driver's License revocation
36 months IID
  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
  Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
Provide DNA Sample, if not already done so.
Count 3: $200 + costs = 705 (Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court).
Jury trial - 12 person on February 10, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on February 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on September 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on December 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Exhibit #P1 Copy of Google Map
Exhibit #D2 Photo of the Intersection - Google Earth
Exhibit #D3 Photo of the Street - Google Earth 
Exhibit #D4 Copy of Incident Report/Narrative - Portage County Sheriff's Office 
Exhibit #D5 Copy of Letter from DOJ dated March 3, 2016
Exhibit #D6 Scaled Map of Incident - Close Up
Exhibit #D7 Scaled Map of Incident - Distant

1:34 p.m. Defendant Derek L Arrigo in court with attorney James Michael Klein. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to Suppress. Exhibits 1, 2, & 3 are marked prior to court.
ADA Cousins calls witness, Officer Kevin Flick, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam. Exhibit P#1 is referred to during direct exam. Exhibit P#1 is moved with no objection and is received by the Court. 
1:42 p.m. Cross exam by Atty James Klein. Exhibit D#4 is marked and referred to during cross exam. Exhibit D#5 is marked and referred to during cross exam. Exhibit CD D#? is marked and referred to during cross exam 1:56 to 2:03 are viewed by the witness. 
2:01 p.m. Re-direct by ADA Cousins. 
2:06 p.m. Atty Klein calls (a reconstruction of incidents/accidents) witness, Krenz, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam. Exhibit D#6 is marked and referred to during direct exam. Atty Klein asks his exhibits be recived with no objection and Court received all exhibits.
2:21 p.m. Cross exam by ADA Cousins.
2:36 p.m. Re-direct by Atty Klein. Moves to have Exhibit #6 be admitted. BTC: Exhibit Received. 
2:38 p.m. Court question witness for clarification. Exhibit #7 is marked and referred to by the Court. Witness steps down. Exhibits 1 - 7 are accounted for by the Clerk. Witness free to go.
2:43 p.m. Atty Klein recalled Officer Flick for further exam. No further questions from the State.
2:45 p.m. Atty Klein final statements in support of motion to suppress.
2:50 p.m. ADA Cousins final statements in objection of the motion.
BY THE COURT:***Motion to suppress stop is denied.

ADA Cousins to schedule with Judge Counsell's JA and the parties.
Final pretrial and trial.
Motion hearing on August 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on April 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
copy of email from Portage County Justice Programs and response from Judge Counsell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derek L Arrigo in court with attorney James Michael Klein. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:34 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Court has received a request for substitution of judge. Arraignment should not affect that.

Atty Klein is prepared to proceed.

Atty Cousins states information was sent to Defense, along with discovery.

Address of Defendant is verified.

Atty Klein has received a copy of the information, same as complaint, aware of penalties and charges.

Defense wavies reading of information.

Defense enters pleas of NOT GUILTY to all charges.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Derek L Arrigo in court with attorney James Michael Klein. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:37 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the plaintiff. 
Deputy K. Flick is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Cousins. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 
Atty Cousins moves for the admission of Exhibit #1. 
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit #1 is received. 
Cross exam by Atty Klein. 

Atty Klein makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files information. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond and conditions of bond are continued. 
  Arraignment scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Derek L Arrigo in court with attorney Klein. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney

Court orders defendant to see Public Defender or retain an attorney.
Bond continued.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
